content: TITLE: Using gitmojis in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: JavaScript example showing how to import and use the gitmojis from the module. The output is an array of objects containing emoji information including the emoji character, entity, code, description, name, and semver value. SOURCE: https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/packages/gitmojis/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { gitmojis } from 'gitmojis' console.log(gitmojis) /* [ { emoji: 'üé®', entity: '🎨', code: ':art:', description: 'Improve structure / format of the code.', name: 'art', semver: null }, { emoji: '‚ö°Ô∏è', entity: '⚡', code: ':zap:', description: 'Improve performance.', name: 'zap', semver: null }, ... ] */ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing gitmoji-cli using npm DESCRIPTION: This command installs gitmoji-cli globally using npm. gitmoji-cli is an interactive client for using emojis in commit messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm i -g gitmoji-cli ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing gitmojis module with npm DESCRIPTION: Command to install the gitmojis package using npm package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/packages/gitmojis/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm i gitmojis ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing gitmojis via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Command to fetch gitmojis data using a curl request to the gitmoji HTTP API endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/packages/gitmojis/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl https://gitmoji.dev/api/gitmojis ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Gitmoji badge to README DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet adds a Gitmoji badge to a project's README. It includes an image with the Gitmoji logo and links to the Gitmoji website.
